positive.review:
Only installed this because my mahjong soul account was deleted lol

The academy teaching mahjong rules and score counting is pretty good. It has a duolingo style system and challenges you to count real hands with very helpful instructions if you get it wrong.

Did not expect to use this as a study tool to learns core counting but here we are.

For some reason there is also a big chested lady spilling wine all over herself when she wins. I don't hate it.
More f2p friendly and got better and more events compared to mahjong soul, also got a better tutorial.
if you're okay with ass'n'tits (and a crying kid [that character is fucking weird ngl]) this game is fire. RC > MJS

If you're an F2P player who played Mahjong Soul and noticed how cheapskate the game is when it comes to giving away free stuff, you should play this game instead. I played Riichi City for 12 hours and I already received more free skins and items than I did on Mahjong Soul after 50 hours. It gives away gacha tickets much more frequently than MS so your chances of getting a new character is that much hugher. This game's ~9GB while MS is ~3GB so obviously this is a higher budget game. And the tutorial is MUCH better, I learned many things from it that MS never taught me. This is easily a better Mahjong game compared to Mahjong Soul and is 10 times more addictive.
Great game to start your mahjong journey, it has duolingo-like mode to learn all the rules. Lots of anime sprites and voice acting makes for fun experience.
Easy grinding for gacha ticket (3-4 ticket/week exc. event) for F2P, but too gooner for me
in the richiied city. straight up "kanking it". and by "it", haha, well. lets justr say. my closed quad
Easily the best Mahjong Client on Steam.
when u try to build yakuman and someone win with riichi/tanyao
like it
Cool
seeeeeeeeeeeegs

Only installed this because my mahjong soul account was deleted lol

The academy teaching mahjong rules and score counting is pretty good. It has a duolingo style system and challenges you to count real hands with very helpful instructions if you get it wrong.

Did not expect to use this as a study tool to learns core counting but here we are.

For some reason there is also a big chested lady spilling wine all over herself when she wins. I don't hate it.

The negative reviews prompted me to actually review this game. It's Mahjong brother, Mahjong with slightly more racy character skins than some Mahjong Soul ones. Mahjong Soul is definitely the standard, but I really like that Riichi City has more daily quests so I feel like I'm getting a little more out of playing more matches. I also really like that your bond with whatever character you chose grows after every match instead of just when you give gifts. The academy that quizzes you is helpful and fun too and there are multiple exercises to do. I also like that all characters voice their yaku at the end of the round instead of having to unlock that through bonding.

One last comment. Riichi City has the better character visual designs IMO but an objectively worse table and tile design. The tiles look so small in the discard piles and the text on them is even smaller. Not sure why reviews are so negative, but I only just started playing it and it seems perfectly fine.

Only 3 hours on Steam but countless on mobile. Once you learn the ropes of riichi mahjong, it genuinely becomes addicting. I will say though daaaamn those are some effective gooner bait skin designs...

The Majong Academy is good for beginners (or people like me who play a different regional variant of majong) to learn the vocab and combos of Riichi majong. I like some of the animations but mainly am focused on gameplay.
More f2p friendly and got better and more events compared to mahjong soul, also got a better tutorial.

Riichi City, if you can stomach the horny character sprites, is the premiere free-to-play mahjong client available internationally. It has great learning tools for beginners, and overall, the level of play on the ranked ladder is much more serious than on competing gacha clients like Mahjong Soul. You may not climb as much initially, but you will learn a lot more over time. For what it's worth, Riichi City is also much more generous to F2P players with gacha tickets not being that difficult to grind for if you play on a regular basis.

(Don't get fooled by the low playtime on Steam, I've also got 32+ hours of time played on mobile as well, and I expect to catch up to my mobile play time in no time.)

It's good, I get to play Mahjong as much as I want, not sure what else you need from an f2p Mahjong client. I picked this game up to learn riichi mahjong for an FF14 achievement and the tutorials and glossary ingame taught me just fine.

You're going to pull a lot of trash from the gacha, but this game at least gives you free rolls pretty often. I've been playing for less than a year and already have the characters I wanted and more so I just bank the tickets for collabs and new characters I like. Only spent 10$ for a guaranteed character gacha they had when I was new because I didn't like the starter characters.

Probably the best Riichi Client available so far.

It has local Yaku options, shows the wall during the game, very smooth and fluid animations, great character designs and very passionate and involved collaboration events.

The developers and support team are also very friendly and always open to suggestions.

It's also very generous with free pulls, giving you around 4 pulls a week. 

On my phone and the dedicated windows cIient, I play it pretty much daily. (which is why my playing hours on steam are rather low comparatively)

-Do be careful of some weird negative review bombs from the competitor, please do check the game for yourself first, its free -

My favorite apps for playing RIICHI style mahjong
Not too serious and your ID permanent
Modern enough so UI , UX , and graphics are appealing. Easy for us to make and manage tournaments
Waifu is here, there, and everywhere, and their alternate skins, so wow making you want to keep winning by MANGAN or more hands.

Excellent Mahjong client. Very smooth gameplay in comparison to Mahjong Soul. Skins are excellent if you like fanservice. Gacha could be a bit cheaper, but the microtransactions don't provide any advantage.
非常好玩，很好上手，居然还有麻将教程可以打卡！！游戏美术和福利比隔壁雀魂好太多了！！祝一番街越做越好！
Nice game. I just wish I could have the chance to get Nishikigi Chisato. Please consider re-running some collabs c:
Need a better way to earn in game currency, would gladly grind for limited drops if it existed, also please make a better way to learn the Yaku and Reference them easier.
mahjongsouls but way less greedy with a better table and game options, the only downside is that it has a lower population.

good riichi mahjong tutorial compared to Mahjong Soul.

Characters and animations are also good.
if you're okay with ass'n'tits (and a crying kid [that character is fucking weird ngl]) this game is fire. RC > MJS
good looking characters and good UI, good Free to play game

If you're an F2P player who played Mahjong Soul and noticed how cheapskate the game is when it comes to giving away free stuff, you should play this game instead. I played Riichi City for 12 hours and I already received more free skins and items than I did on Mahjong Soul after 50 hours. It gives away gacha tickets much more frequently than MS so your chances of getting a new character is that much hugher. This game's ~9GB while MS is ~3GB so obviously this is a higher budget game. And the tutorial is MUCH better, I learned many things from it that MS never taught me. This is easily a better Mahjong game compared to Mahjong Soul and is 10 times more addictive.
Great game to start your mahjong journey, it has duolingo-like mode to learn all the rules. Lots of anime sprites and voice acting makes for fun experience.
Easy grinding for gacha ticket (3-4 ticket/week exc. event) for F2P, but too gooner for me
I play mainly on tablet/phone, runs smoother and looks better than Mahjong Soul, also more modern UI

Despite the backlash about the really NSFW costume (Which you can turn off by using the PG Mode), I still continue to play this one instead of a certain browser mahjong game that also came to Steam. They give you more tickets for gacha than the other one.
Great mahjong , Smooth GamePlay , Lovely Graphic . Sound actor feels competing in Real Life table.
in the richiied city. straight up "kanking it". and by "it", haha, well. lets justr say. my closed quad

Gonna give my review in hopes of balancing all the chinese negative reviews who are all mad because they seemingly don't understand probability. Go ahead, go and translate them. I'm not lying. They are raging because they don't feel they are lucky like other people. (The code for this client's tile draws is freely available to see on their website btw.)

I like this modern riichi client, unlike its competitor, Mahjong Soul, this client isn't so rough around the edges. The wall is visible during play, the music doesn't audibly loop and you can style your client in lots of different fashions.

Pros:
- Overall a more polished modern client that doesn't randomly disconnect and reconnect players all the time (like MJS.)
- Probably the best mahjong tutorial (duolingo style teaching. This alone is worth the download, even if you intend to play on a different client.)
- High quality backgrounds and background music, which you can save as loadouts. I have a japanese spring/summer setup and a more cosy sky bar setup for fall/winter. The music bops too (and you can't hear it loop like in MJS.)
- Gives you a fair share of freebies.

Cons:
- There's a lot of lewd characters. I know there is a SFW-mode which defaults to the standard outfit, but some of these are still really lewd either way. While I know it's a stretch, I wish there was an SFW version of each outfit.
- Some of the menu choices are confusing, especially at first. Board setup/decor plan is hidden in the corner of the char tab when it could have been together with layout/background setup for instance.

And a final tip: The prices are better if you go directly on the riichi city website, plus you build bonus points.
I came here to escape from a certain cat girl.
too many feet where are the girls showing off their armpits
Easily the best Mahjong Client on Steam.
I play this when MajSoul is under Maintenance.
i got a yakuman in my second ever game on here ... thank you riichi city...
Mahjong and DONKERS? AYOO!
like it
when u try to build yakuman and someone win with riichi/tanyao
Cool
seeeeeeeeeeeegs

negative.review: Mahjong is a trash game for trash people.
There's just something about it that makes the vibes feel off.
nope
nope

The game doesn't wait for you. If you happen to have bad WiFi (which I'm pretty sure I don't, but the game claims I do), the match usually starts when not everyone is ready. It feels bad to make everyone else in the room wait for you when you're just hoping that the loading screen would go away. This is not an issue in MJS.

 RC gives you free tickets to seem like it's more f2p friendly.. buuut the gacha rates are nonexistent.

And my god, the game has so. Much. Fanservice. And the family friendly mode doesn't help much, since the characters appear in events and log in screens. I thought MJS went a bit too hard with the fanservice.. I was very wrong. Also the lolicon content is quite disgusting..

I've also heard that the rankings are unfair, but I can't currently say, since I haven't played this game for that long.

I have mixed feelings on if the games are rigged or not. From my experience, the players you know have spent money on the game, usually get the best hands and win very fast, and I'm not the only one who's seen this happen. Looking at logs, the whale players get the best starting hands, and get every tile they need to form a winning hand.

And i'm pretty sure I've also had cheaters in the same lobby. (For context, I play 3p where there is no north seat) A player being in the moon room, only having a character from a gacha, no banner or frame discarding north tiles yet not being AFK and winning with very good hands. Tho I'm unable to fully confirm their cheating and reporting them.

The different minigames/ gamemodes are fun, but if you just want to play riichi mahjong, go play MJS, there's a free client on steam, web browser and mobile.

I initially wanted to like this game. I downloaded it not knowing that it was a gacha game and just wanted to learn how to play mahjong.  The game's tutorial does a very poor job of preparing you to play the game.  Its just one massive info dump with no room for experimentation. There is a built in duolingo style tutorial on learning how the game works, but its so painfully slow that I can't see myself spending any more time on this game. 

I'm not necessarily opposed to playing a gacha, but I was unable to figure out how you can earn any pulls during my playtime.  I managed to get a single pull within 2 hours and according to other reviews, the pull rates are awful. 

The art and music is great but the game does such a poor job of explaining the basics of mahjong that I couldn't complete a match against easy bots. Would not recommend if you are trying to learn how to play.

If you don't already know how to play, stay out, tutorial on this game is the worst i've ever seen, doesn't let you play, just keeps infodumping rules out of content that there is no way you can learn all at the same time without ever playing.
there needs to be an option to turn all graphics off entirely.  i just want to play mahjong, cant play this in class
The portrayal of underage characters is gross. Stopped playing because I don't want to be on a police watch list. Gooner material is one thing, but leave kids out of it. FREAKS.
It's boring because don't understand anything, trash game and lot p2w x-x
Mahjong is a trash game for trash people.
There's just something about it that makes the vibes feel off.
GACHA RATES ARE TERRIBLE
nope

The game doesn't wait for you. If you happen to have bad WiFi (which I'm pretty sure I don't, but the game claims I do), the match usually starts when not everyone is ready. It feels bad to make everyone else in the room wait for you when you're just hoping that the loading screen would go away. This is not an issue in MJS.

 RC gives you free tickets to seem like it's more f2p friendly.. buuut the gacha rates are nonexistent.

And my god, the game has so. Much. Fanservice. And the family friendly mode doesn't help much, since the characters appear in events and log in screens. I thought MJS went a bit too hard with the fanservice.. I was very wrong. Also the lolicon content is quite disgusting..

I've also heard that the rankings are unfair, but I can't currently say, since I haven't played this game for that long.

I have mixed feelings on if the games are rigged or not. From my experience, the players you know have spent money on the game, usually get the best hands and win very fast, and I'm not the only one who's seen this happen. Looking at logs, the whale players get the best starting hands, and get every tile they need to form a winning hand.

And i'm pretty sure I've also had cheaters in the same lobby. (For context, I play 3p where there is no north seat) A player being in the moon room, only having a character from a gacha, no banner or frame discarding north tiles yet not being AFK and winning with very good hands. Tho I'm unable to fully confirm their cheating and reporting them.

The different minigames/ gamemodes are fun, but if you just want to play riichi mahjong, go play MJS, there's a free client on steam, web browser and mobile.

I initially wanted to like this game. I downloaded it not knowing that it was a gacha game and just wanted to learn how to play mahjong.  The game's tutorial does a very poor job of preparing you to play the game.  Its just one massive info dump with no room for experimentation. There is a built in duolingo style tutorial on learning how the game works, but its so painfully slow that I can't see myself spending any more time on this game. 

I'm not necessarily opposed to playing a gacha, but I was unable to figure out how you can earn any pulls during my playtime.  I managed to get a single pull within 2 hours and according to other reviews, the pull rates are awful. 

The art and music is great but the game does such a poor job of explaining the basics of mahjong that I couldn't complete a match against easy bots. Would not recommend if you are trying to learn how to play.

If you don't already know how to play, stay out, tutorial on this game is the worst i've ever seen, doesn't let you play, just keeps infodumping rules out of content that there is no way you can learn all at the same time without ever playing.
there needs to be an option to turn all graphics off entirely.  i just want to play mahjong, cant play this in class
The portrayal of underage characters is gross. Stopped playing because I don't want to be on a police watch list. Gooner material is one thing, but leave kids out of it. FREAKS.
It's boring because don't understand anything, trash game and lot p2w x-x
Mahjong is a trash game for trash people.
There's just something about it that makes the vibes feel off.
GACHA RATES ARE TERRIBLE
nope
